wordpressPost.title: Should you age naturally or get procedures done?
wordpressPost.content:
Should you age naturally or get procedures done?

Yesterday I got Fraxel Laser on my face.  I was excited to think that my thick textured skin could possibly be eliminated by burning off the top layer of my skin.

While that may have been exciting to think that I would have nicer and even younger looking skin, when I woke up this morning I looked like I had been in a fire.

Even worse, when the furniture delivery guys came, they had a look of shock when I answered the door!  I could see that they were very uncomfortable so I relieved their tension by telling them I had been in a freak accident!! Okay, I told them that I had laser on my face.  They weren’t amused.

I couldn’t go to work today let alone out in public because I know people will look and people will ask “What the hell happened to your face?”  I know this because I always do things to my face and people looked and people asked!

One day, I bought a skin peel online, a peel that no regular person such as myself without a medial license should have been able to purchase, and I used that peel and gave myself third degree burns under my eyes, and along my nose.  It was not pretty and I had to hide under a cap for about three months.

Long story short, my journey for younger skin went from trying to get rid of my wrinkles to searching for a plastic surgeon to undo the damage that I had done.

That was about four years ago and there wasn’t much the doctor could do.  In time the scars have lightened but in no way are they gone.  A constant reminder that in the wrong hands, chemicals can do some serious damage when you don’t know what your’re doing.

Did I learn a lesson?  Yep, and that is for most of the stuff that wounds, let a professional do it.  But, will I ever stop anti-aging? No.

Which brings me to the point of this post.  While reading emails this morning an article about Julia Roberts popped up and it was about her stating that women should just be themselves and she said “Perfection is a disease of a nation.”  I agree.  I’m not trying to be perfect.  No one can be.  Believe me, I not deluded in thinking that I’m not getting old and that soon, my wrinkles will be beyond repair.

Here is a little more of what Julia Roberts said about women and aging:

“We overlay our faces with tons of make-up. We get botoxs [sic] and even starve ourselves to become that perfect size. We try to fix something but you can’t fix what you can’t see. It’s the soul that needs the surgery.”

Roberts, who recently attended an event with her kids, also issued a call to action saying it’s time to take a stand. “How can you expect someone else to love you if you don’t love yourself? You have to be happy with yourself. It doesn’t matter what you look like on the outside, it’s whats on the inside that counts.” (https://www.yahoo.com/style/julia-roberts-fights-beauty-standards-with-a-128644174578.html

Here I am reading this and agreeing with what she says and I really think she is right however, we live in a world where when you hit about 50 as a woman to men, you disappear.  I like myself and it should be each persons prerogative to do what they want but only if they do it for themselves.

Sure you could be married, in a relationship but, you still want to look good and feel good about yourself.

If that means that some of us want to fight aging a little and get some procedures here and there, well, to each her own..

If you don’t that’s okay too 🙂

Before you go, I created “The 7 Steps to Rejuvenate and Renewal.” In just seven

steps you can feel amazing without depriving your self!  Click the link below:
